data.title: BEST BBQ I'VE EVER EATEN
data.text: The brisket melts in your mouth, the sausage has just the right amount of kick, and the sides are amazing. The jalapeño creamed corn changed my life. I took a bite of it and cried. It's a nice atmosphere, too. They have a warmer full of homemade bread, and it's amazing. After you go to Sharon's you will be fat and happy.

data.title: Just ok
data.text: We moved to Abilene a month ago and I never thought it would be so hard to find great bbq in Texas. This is another on the list of just ok. It really was nothing special. The food is ok. The place is ok. (I could care less about the place as long as the food is great, which it's not). The ladies behind the counter were very nice though.

data.title: Good BBQ
data.text: They have a lunch special and it was reasonable.  They have good potato salad and I am kind of picky on potato salad.  I like it chunky and theirs is creamy.  Kind of a long wait because it is a cafeteria style.

data.title: Great BBQ and Sides !!
data.text: Our only complaint is the plates are too fimsy for all the good things you have on your buffet. The sides were all delicious ( many places just have them as an afterthought), but here coleslaw, potato salad and beans very tasty. Had homemade bread and corn bread and again, great and hot !! The brisket was so tender and smoked to perfection and the chicken the same !!  Will definitely go back when in town !!!!!!!

data.title: lunch
data.text: good food the cashier does not listen good told her I wanted a large drink and ice for yeti and she just heard ice didn't have to pay for drink though so that was good

data.title: Load Your Plate Buffet
data.text: We were looking for BBQ while travelling thru the area and our hotel recommended Sharon's. We had the buffet style dinner with brisket and ribs.  We found ourselves loading our flimsy styrofoam plates so we could try the buffet side options.  The cream corn was very good and the coleslaw as well.  The potato salad texture was like mashed potatoes but was tasty despite being overly creamy.  The BBQ was average and satisfied our craving.

data.title: Mr. Carl Graham
data.text:
I don't know why this place is not ranked higher than it is. I have eaten in most bbq places in town and consider this one the best  or as Sharon says YUM YUM.
Her jalapeño corn was the best. Got to love the cornbread as well. Though the potato salad wasn't the typical mustard potato salad you usually see it was quite good. I wish they would put sideboards on the plates cause i just  couldn't get everything on there i wanted. 
Sharon you rock. And so do the folks that work for you....Thanks.

data.title: Everything was perfect...
data.text: We are looking for a casual dinner place and found Sharon's. Very friendly staff, good BBQ-food and ice cold beer. We had the 2-3 meal with 3 types of meat with sides. We were totally satisfied...thumbs up.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Come for the meat. Go back for the corn casserole. And turkey and ribs and sausage and brisket. Very casual atmosphere. Awesome friendly service.

data.title: Horrible
data.text: I have eaten at the establishment twice. Both times my friends and I have became ill soon after eating there. The only thing that really tasted good was the jalapeno corn, the other items were undesirable. The entire place was so dirty and I wonder how on earth they could pass a health inspection. Will never go back.

data.title: Green Beans and more...
data.text:
This place just keeps on getting better!.  I ate there this April (2016) and had beef, ham, and ribs.  For sure they were all excellent!  On my self serve plate was green beans, potato salad and slaw (together) and red beans. I topped it off with sauce, dill pickles and onions, and on my way got a slice of jalapeno cornbread that had just a hint of sweetness and a slice of the best home made white bread I have ever eaten.
The trip before last I just had a ham sandwich and it was really good!

data.title: Heavenly BBQ in Abilene
data.text: I try to get here at least once when I'm visiting my family in Abilene. The portions are good, the price is good, and the atmosphere is homestyle. You can order take out - and even drive through!

data.title: Good place for lunch.
data.text: Really good Texas BBQ and all the fixings.  It is a buffet style so I recommend this place for lunch or a family dinner. Really good place to go and fill up on BBQ.

data.title: have lunch there at least once a week
data.text: Good fast service!  Food is excellant , no matter the choice, I usually get the daily special.  The French fries are exceptional.

data.title: BLD-big Let down
data.text:
We rolled into town from a eight hour drive with some serious jonesing for Texas BBQ.....dry rub, this way that way who knows what is best I just want some good BBQ.   This was a locals recommendation.  

We were only going to be here for about 24 hours so we wanted the best and this is what a local recommended. 

First impression ...smells good....once inside there was a big menu on the wall and it took our party of eight a little bit to decide what we wanted which seemed to bother the group of staff standing in that area.  No lines behind us just seem annoyed these out of towners had no idea what was good until I asked what their recommendation was.....

I love comfort food and behind the glass buffet type line were some of my favorites, mashed potatoes and gravy, mac n cheese, corn, okra....yea baby just like at Grandma's house.....yes there were quite a few flies....and I heard the corn bread was to die for.....

I can put up with ugly, old school surroundings and do it all the time for some good grub.....this place was stuck in the early 80's again I'm cool with that if ...

Well looks as mama used to say "can be deceiving."  The food was honestly just barely average...and we were starving and it still was just average.  I would not go back to Sharon's, no love, no love for the BBQ, no love for the customer....they should be ashamed because Texas hospitality can be the real deal and when it is around good BBQ it all comes together. 

Sorry can't recommend Sharon's.

data.title: Confused staff
data.text: Staff were unable to input orders properly & admitted to missing an order completely. Menu is written on a wall in a dark corner. Food was in small serving after ordering large portions. Jalapeño corn has no taste of jalapeños. Rest of potato salad & corn bread was plain tasting. Place appeared not to be clean.

data.title: Where's the beef?
data.text:
After reading great reviews of this establishment my friends and I decided to check it out.  From my impression of the place the girl working the register was very helpful in explaining what was on the menu.  As for the food selection I had to compete with the local fly population to find a portion of food that was not the fly's dinner.  I can understand fly's are just doing the Lord's work.  As for the beef I would compare it to a nice side of jerky.  The establishment looked as though it hadn't been renovated or thoroughly cleaned in quiet awhile.  My rating is two stars because the buffet style food looked and tasted less than desirable and breads lacked in basic flavors.

All things considered I would not write home about this location nor would I visit again.

data.title: 5* BBQ Yummm
data.text: Amazing food and service. They were so friendly and understanding that we are new to this type of bbq style restaurant but didn't hesitate to the welcome us with their friendly attitudes! The food was amazing. Ribs fell off the bone and pulled brisket sandwich was to die for. This will have to be a future weekly stop!!

data.title: Always Delicious!
data.text: Our favorite BBQ in Abilene! Sharon's BBQ never disappoints! The jalapeno corn is our favorite side dish. The meats are amazing. My favorites are the brisket and sausage.

data.title: You Hungry?
data.text:
Good BBQ. We spent all day at a grandson's all star baseball tournament and were hungry. We decided to use Sharon's take-out instead of dining in. Great brisket, sausage and ribs were cut and wrapped to arrive home warm and juicy. 

What meal would be complete without sides. In addition to slaw and potato salad, Sharon's hot corn casserole is a must.
